perturbation.original_text: The term of this Agreement shall be for one (1) year commencing on the Effective Date and automatically renewing annually thereafter, unless either party provides a thirty-day notice of written termination one to the other ("Term").
perturbation.changed_text: The term of this Agreement shall be for one (1) year commencing on the Effective Date and automatically renewing annually thereafter, unless either party provides a ninety-day notice of verbal termination one to the other ("Term").
perturbation.explanation: The change from 'thirty-day notice of written termination' to 'ninety-day notice of verbal termination' introduces a contradiction. Contract law generally requires termination notices to be written to ensure clarity and documentation. A verbal notice is difficult to prove and enforce, creating uncertainty. This undermines the legal principle of clear and unambiguous contract terms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law - Requirement for written notice in contract termination.

perturbation.original_text: ESSI will provide Talent with one-million (1,000,000) shares of restricted common stock issued within ten business days of execution of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: ESSI will provide Talent with one-million (1,000,000) shares of unrestricted common stock issued within twenty business days at ESSI's discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The change from 'restricted' to 'unrestricted' common stock alters the nature of the equity payment, impacting its valuation and transferability. Also, changing 'within ten business days of execution' to 'within twenty business days at ESSI's discretion' makes the delivery of the stock discretionary rather than obligatory within a specified timeframe. This creates uncertainty and undermines the enforceability of the consideration clause, conflicting with securities regulations regarding clear terms of equity compensation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Regulations - Requirements for clear terms of equity compensation and restrictions on stock transfer.

perturbation.original_text: ESSI shall be solely responsible for all liability arising out of production, distribution and sale of its product(s). ESSI hereby agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless Talent, his agents, representatives and employees (referred to collectively as "Talent Indemnities") from and against any and all claims, actions, causes of action, damages, injuries, expenses, liabilities (joint and several), penalties fines, attorney fees, court costs, and any other expenses incurred by Talent Indemnities arising out of (1) breach by ESSI of any of the terms, representations or warranties made by ESSI in this Agreement
perturbation.changed_text: ESSI shall be mostly responsible for some liability arising out of production, distribution and sale of its product(s). ESSI hereby agrees to indemnify, defend and hold harmless Talent, his agents, representatives and employees (referred to collectively as "Talent Indemnities") from and against any and all claims, actions, causes of action, damages, injuries, expenses, liabilities (joint and several), penalties fines, attorney fees, court costs, and any other expenses incurred by Talent Indemnities arising out of (1) breach by ESSI of a few of the terms, representations or warranties made by ESSI in this Agreement
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'solely responsible' and 'any' are replaced with 'mostly responsible' and 'some'. Similarly, 'any of the terms' became 'a few of the terms'. This weakens ESSI's indemnification obligations and introduces ambiguity. It becomes unclear to what extent ESSI is liable and which breaches are covered, contradicting the intent of a clear indemnification clause and making enforcement difficult.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Requirement for clear and unambiguous terms, particularly in indemnification clauses.
